page.title: 14PLACES OF INTEREST
page.content: The Severn Bore comes once a month and the best places to see it are : Weir Green, Elmore Back and Stonebench . Stonebench got its name from rocks that lie on the bed of the river and when the ships came through it ripped their keels . The Severn Bore is biggest and best seen in mid_winter and has been known to flood many times . In 1947 there was a very big flood . It flooded most of Elmore and the water went right up to Shard House . The Pilot Inn was opened in 1827 and it has always been an inn. It is situated nearly on the canal bank . The canal itself used to have approximately 30_40 ships a day and they carried 300_400 tonnes . Nowadays they have three or four ships a week and their cargo is at least 1000 tonnes . They stop at the B.P. Oil Terminal ,which is closing down.
